title: Running R on a Webpage
text:
WebR Test Console
  
  
    
      Loading webR, please wait...
      
      Run
    
    
    
  



I am interested in learning more about the internet and websites. I am an R enthusiast and want to blend the two where I can. I learned recently about WebR and was curious to see how it worked. I saw this example on how to create an environment where you can execute R code on a webpage and tried it out. Here is a link to the example from WebR Documentation.

title: Running R on a Webpage
text: I am interested in learning more about the internet and websites. I am an R enthusiast and want to blend the two where I can. I learned recently about WebR and was curious to see how it worked. I saw this example on how to create an environment where you can execute R code on a webpage and tried it out. Here is a link to the example from WebR Documentation.

title: Star Realms
text:
Input the log from your game below to see a display of authority throughout the game.

  
    Plotly Example
    
    
  
  
    
      Loading webR, please wait...
      
      
      Run
    
    
    
    
    
    
  



I enjoy playing the game Star Realms, a game where players battle it out using fleets of space ships to see who is the last remaining. As I am more familiar with R, I wrote code that extracts information about the game by turn, including authority, cards gained, cards scrapped, and more. After learning about WebR, I was curious to see if I could run a simplified version of the script that looks only at authority for both players throughout the game. After a bit of learning and research, was able to do so. You can copy your game log and paste it in the text box above, click run, and see a display of authority levels throughout the game.

title: Star Realms
text: I enjoy playing the game Star Realms, a game where players battle it out using fleets of space ships to see who is the last remaining. As I am more familiar with R, I wrote code that extracts information about the game by turn, including authority, cards gained, cards scrapped, and more. After learning about WebR, I was curious to see if I could run a simplified version of the script that looks only at authority for both players throughout the game. After a bit of learning and research, was able to do so. You can copy your game log and paste it in the text box above, click run, and see a display of authority levels throughout the game.
